Never before have I been so utterly befuddled at every solitary minute of an anime series. Even actions that I was able to justify with logical explanations were then turned by the series itself into nonsensical, self contradictory reasoning. Big Order goes out of its way to read the guide to solid storytelling upside down, without wearing glasses, and eating the lamp which is allowing it to see the words.
There's no point going into minutia, we'd be here all day. Let's start with the story. Our main character, Whocares McProtagonist, gets blackmailed into announcing that he is trying to take over the world with thisorganization of superpowered beings. Yes, that is our start. Each of them has a unique ability given to them by a 'wish'. Usually the wish involved something causing them to think 'I want to survive', therefore the character's power is immortality. It seems to be a base desire in a stressful moment that allowed them to get out of it. Then there are other characters with robot unicorns who fire hyper beams that I REALLY want to know what wishes led to that, but who cares let's never explain backstories.


The first half is about this organization using McProtagonist to take over a city in Japan as their first conquest. The series sets up how the rest of the world hates them, how people CHEER in the streets at live executions of their family members. This entire plotline is abandoned halfway through when a villain shows up, which the series becomes about defeating with no real mentions of their main goal. NO points follow from one half to the other. They face no issues from being so detested and starting a war. Who needs consequences, right?


Next big point: our main character has the most broken power there has ever been. He can literally control reality itself by his own words in any area he has stepped. He can defy gravity, the most fundamental force in the universe. He can take control of the wills of the people around him. Yet whenever an action scene happens, he forgets he can do anything except... I don't even know, he just exerts forces outwards in palm thrusts I guess.


I don't even know where to go from there in all honesty, and that's fine, because the series doesn't know where it's going either, nor how much budget is left as it nears its end. Whoops, money gone!


Oh, I guess a giant rock golem shows up near halfway through as though this is normal, even though we've never seen anything remotely like it. But I didn't even care.


Big Order is a masterpiece of non sequitur nonsense. I'm impressed that it was even written considering the author must have been so distracted by the fact that the rest of their house was on fire. If you have a bunch of friends with you or can enjoy laughing at a building that is falling apart from the bottom up and spinning while it plummets toward the ground, then its spinning digs it deeper and deeper below the surface like a drill, I wholeheartedly recommend watching this series from beginning to end. In episode 3, you will know if you are in the Valhalla of terrible animes or not. This was one of the most enjoyable experiences I'd had in ages, and that wasn't because of anything the show was TRYING to do.


But if you want to watch something that's actually good, stay far away. Seriously. I only give 1's if there is nothing objectively redeemable. Even good music will earn at least a 2 since that meant someone tried and didn't simply play the same jazzy song over every action scene, even when it didn't match the tone at all.


That's all. Review done.

What did I just watch? It had a very good first episode. A get set up for a nince yandere and world domination plus yandere girlfriend fantasy fufillment. It was clearly supposed to be a future diary fanfic but they couldnt even do that right. It was a cluster fuck. Terrible plot twists. Shitty one dimensional characters or flat out no characterization at all. The main character is a retard that doesn't even use his powers when it would make the most sense. I really wanted to like this anime but I just couldnt. The character designs were also pure cancer.

My review summed up in one sentence: Big Order had a lot of Big Potential that went to waste. Here is why:
The idea was brilliant and original. Super natural abilities were given to those with one true wish that they desired. Those that desired wealth were deemed shallow, those that desired immortality deemed fearful, those that desired an all too common wish deemed unoriginal. Only those with true desires and wished got the ability to do them. < This here my friends is a great plot and a great idea.
BUT, the execution of this brilliant idea was lackluster at most. The main character lacked convictionup till the final minute where he was spurred on by a girl that loved him yet forced him to man up for his love of his sister. (Ugh I hate it when a girl loves a guy but has to convince him to chase his love for another, EVEN WORSE he needed her help to accomplish it)


The music was absolutely Mediocre at best with music that I wouldn't even have as background music under any circumstance.


There was no backstory established for the other 10 supporting cast, they were just given abilities without any feelings to it. Just *poof* have some super powers and a halfhearted reason.


There were plot holes so far and many that it was almost impossible to ignore and just accept them. The anime was just shoving facts down my throat and hoping that I would be ok with it.


The ending to the anime was horrendous to say the least. The massive plot hole with the underwhelming as hell conclusion. THE GUY'S ULTIMATE WISH AND DESIRE CAME TRUE AND HE BECAME A FISH ABOUT IT. HE WASN'T HAPPY, HE WASN'T CONTENT, HE WAS EMOTIONLESS LIKE A GOD DAMN FISH.


However, the anime did have some good points.


The characters went directions that weren't absolute cliches, like the sister becoming a badass. The bad guys were good guys but is willing to give up anything to make their dreams come true (looking at you lieutenant)


It was action packed without much boring moments, no fillers or empty episodes ... although that comes with the 10 episodes limitation.


All in all I did enjoy it, it had the potential to be a master piece, but it failed to do so.

Therefore I rate it a solid 6.8/10

BIG Review 
      So you may be wondering why the I rated it so high on enjoyment. Here is why, have you ever watched something so amazingly bad that you enjoyed it? This is what happened to me concerning Big Order. Its about a kid that gets some magical power from a girl named C.C.... uh no no daisy that's her name. And his power is uhhh well he can literally control anything and everything INCLUDING GOD if the plot calls for it. He is trying to make the world a better place for his sister Nunnall...uhh I mean Senathat's right. He is trying to make the world a better place for his sister Sena and when he tried to do so he accidentally BLOWS it up. \n\n
      So I better stop rambling about the story before you get 100% lost before even watching it. This anime is so bad, that it's actually kind of good. This anime is sooooo easy to hate that you love hating it. The pacing is awful, the story is a copy of Code Geass' story if Code Geass' story got hit in the head by a lot of bricks. The characters all suck and you love to hate every stupid thing they say or do. At the end of an episode after focusing hard and trying to pay attention I simply said "what" the story makes no sense at all. So in conclusion Big Order is a Big piece of garbage, but its so bad that it is good. If you are bored, or angry at something this anime will help you. It's so idiotic and terrible that its actually hilarious. Grab a friend that is equally as bored or angry as you are and watch Big order, I promise you will be in tears by the end of episode 3 and you will have a blast bashing another man's life work. Thanks for reading!

Saying that this anime is so bad, that it is good might feel overly simplistic and at this point probably redundant, however it remains a pretty accurate summary of my feelings towards this series, I would even dare to say that, aside from Garzeys Wing, no other anime, that I have seen, has rivaled Big Order in this regard.
 The OST is surprisingly nice, there are some pleasent colours and the directing is certainly unique, but if you are not delighted by the terrible characters and story these things will definitely not win you over, however if you are, than Big Order might just bethe unintentional comedy for you.

Pros   Good action
          Excellent voice acting from the cast especially Rin's seiyuu 
Cons Inconsistent art style 
         Hard to follow story 
         Anime was to short of length 
From the beginning what drew me to this anime was the story and the action that i knew this anime would have. While the story itself was not awful i felt that this was caused by the fact that thisanime only had 10 episodes. In the latter however i wasn't disappointed as the fight scenes in the anime were really well done and enjoyable. \n\n
In terms of voice acting the anime had a number of veterans in its cast including one of my favorites Saori Hayami. As a whole the voice acting for the anime was top notch with particular praise going to the seiyuu's  for Rin and Iyu respectively as they were truly amazing. \n\n
In terms of cons however the anime has some issues that stop it from being one of the great ones. The first issue is the art style that this anime used. While the art style was fine in most cases i felt that it was not consistent through the season which is a bit odd. The story itself is rather complex and not explained nearly enough and as a result is sometimes hard to follow especially if you come back to an episode after some time. Finally at only 10 episodes long i felt that the anime was a bit to short which consequently affected the story as well as the ending. \n\n
Overall Big order was a decent anime that was let down by its short length and its story.

This was a cool anime with a interesting premise, where people are granted wishes, and then given powers based upon those wishes.  I found it very much fascinating, most of the powers were unique in their own way.
The story I enjoyed and works for the most part, it did feel a tad rushed near the end as this is only a ten episode series, and felt like it could have used another two to three more episodes to flesh it out, but it still works, and there are surprises along the way that are revealed over time.
I think part of the strength of thisanime though is the characters, many of them have their own powers and abilities, with a decent supporting cast, though they don't all get enough time to shine, they are given their moments.\n\n
I give this a recommendation for sure, just realize some of the things I mentioned above.  A 8/10

Eiji Hoshimura has been selected to become an Order - someone who can can be granted any wish and in turn gain a power based on what they wish for. Somehow his wish to rule the world ends up bringing about the destruction of the world and also grants him the power to control others. Ten years later, people continue their lives but are full of hatred for Orders after learning of their existence and enjoy seeing them die a horrible death. New Orders continue to appear and as they reveal themselves Eiji manages to control one of the assasins Rin out to avenge herparents who died during the destruction. As Rin continues to find ways to get her revenge on Eiji, Eiji is blackmailed into becoming a puppet "leader" by the rest of the Orders who aim to conquer the world by force.


This show features a sadistic heroine and funnily enough, the Manga this show is based on is by Sakae Esuno who also wrote Future Diary which is also another show with a similar heroine.


If you like sadistic cute girls enjoy causing pain to others you might enjoy this. Using the world full of hate as an excuse, the show doesn't hesitate to go about slaughtering people or using death as a joke. Outside of that, every episode sheds light on each Order who have some silly powers and personalities. So one moment you're watching gruesome deaths, the next you're laughing at silly things. Somtimes the show tries to look smart as if there's some clever scheme going on... Overall the direction doesn't feel very well thought out. Like random ideas thrown in.


There's little to like about this show. No good art work, direction's ridiculously silly, world setting's unoriginal, silly powers. Future Diary was better than this.
